text: Truro is the county town of Cornwall. Truro may also refer to: ==Places== ;Australia *Truro, South Australia ;Canada *Truro, Nova Scotia ;United Kingdom *Truro (UK Parliament constituency), Cornwall, England ;United States *Truro Township, Knox County, Illinois *Truro, Iowa *Truro, Massachusetts *Truro Township, Franklin County, Ohio *Truro Parish, Virginia **Truro Church (Fairfax, Virginia) ==People== *Thomas Wilde, 1st Baron Truro (1783–1855), English jurist and Lord Chancellor ==Transportation== *GWR 3700 Class 3440 City of Truro, a Great Western Railway 4-4-0 steam locomotive, is claimed to be the first locomotive to have exceeded 100 MPH *Truro, a West Cornwall Railway locomotive ==Other uses== * Truro Murders, a series of murders in South Australia named after the town near where the remains of the victims were dumped *Truro (ship), a ship that carried the first batch of indentured Indian labourers to South Africa * Fictional Florida town in the 1980s TV series Flamingo Road. ==See also== *Truro station (disambiguation) Category:Place name disambiguation pages
title: Truro (disambiguation)
